title: Job Vacancies at Jiji.ng
content:
Jiji.ng is the largest online marketplace in Nigeria which connects Real Buyers with Sellers. Jiji was launched in 2014 and currently serves over 200 Million users in 5 different countries.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Vendor Acquisition Agent 

Job Location: Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are hiring Vendor Acquisition Agents who want to build a career in Sales, Marketing, & Business Development.


Your Task
     

            
    




	Communicate and sell Jiji to sellers
	Register clients/sellers on our platform


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE
	Must be resident in Kano
	Willingness to learn
	18-45 years of age


Benefits


	Earn up to ?200k monthly
	Get paid for every seller you register
	Earn commissions of up to30% on sales.


Application Closing Date: 31st March, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Merchant Acquisition Associate

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are looking to hire Merchant Acquisition Associates who want to build a career in Sales, Marketing & Business Development.


Scope of work
As a Merchant Acquisition Associate, you will be required to:


	Identify new businesses interested in marketing and advertising products & services on Jiji and register them on the platform
	Enlighten business owners on the benefits of Jiji’s Premium Services
	Sell Jiji’s Subscription Packages to business owners
	Use CRM tool to update and upload relevant sales information.


Requirement


	Applicants should be between the ages of 18 and 40 years.


Join our team to enjoy benefits such as;


	World-class on-the-job experience & training certificate.
	Fantastic career growth trajectory.
	Earn up to N200,000 monthly.
	Learn new skills and gain hands-on job experience.
	Get 17% of the total sales you make as commissions.
	Get up to ?34,000 in extra allowances.
	HMO plan upon confirmation.
	Team bonding activities and events.


Application Closing Date: 28th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Sales Associate 

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are looking to hire Sales Associates who want to build a career in Sales, Marketing & Business Development.


Scope of work
As a Sales Associate, you will be required to:


	Identify new businesses interested in marketing and advertising products & services on Jiji and register them on the platform
	Enlighten business owners on the benefits of Jiji’s Premium Services
	Sell Jiji’s Subscription Packages to business owners
	Use CRM tool to update and upload relevant sales information


Requirement


	Applicants should be between the ages of 18 and 40 years.


Join our team to enjoy benefits such as;


	World-class on-the-job experience & training certificate.
	Fantastic career growth trajectory.
	Earn up to ?200,000 monthly.
	Learn new skills and gain hands-on job experience.
	Get 17% of the total sales you make as commissions.
	Get up to ?34,000 in extra allowances.
	HMO plan upon confirmation.
	Team bonding activities and events.


Application Closing Date: 28th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

Sales & Marketing Executive Job at Erisco Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Erisco Foods Limited is an indigenous food product manufacturer, incorporated in Nigeria in 2004 and started operations in 2009, manufacturing Tomato Paste, Seasoning, Rice, Milk cubes and more. We are firmly committed to producing high-quality products that combine nourishment with value pricing, as they strive to become one of Nigeria’s largest indigenous foodmanufacturers on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales & Marketing Executive

Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Sales and Marketing Executive to drive business growth in Ogudu/Ogba
	The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying new market opportunities, managing client relationships, executing sales strategies and contributing to overall brand performance in the region.


Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities in Ogudu/ Ogba markets to expand customer base and drive revenue growth.
	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients, wholesalers, and distributors to enhance customer loyalty and satisfaction.
	Implement sales strategies to meet and exceed assigned sales targets, ensuring consistent product availability and visibility across the territory.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer behavior to provide actionable insights that support sales and marketing strategies.
	Conduct product presentations, coordinate roadshows, and participate in promotional campaigns to increase product awareness and boost sales.
	Provide accurate and timely reports on sales performance, market activities, stock levels, and customer feedback to management.
	Liaise with internal departments (e.g., logistics, customer service) to ensure timely delivery of goods and resolution of client issues.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Sc. in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in field sales, preferably within the FMCG or food manufacturing industry.
	Strong knowledge of the Ogba/Ogudu market and its distribution channels.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently.
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic reporting tools.
	Candidate must reside in Ogudu/ Ogba Axis


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@eriscofoodsltd.com.ng using "Sales and Marketing Executive - Ogudu" as the subject of the email.

Note


	Proximity to Ogudu/Ogba/Ikeja Axisis an added advantage.
	Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Telesales Officer / Customer Service Representative Job at Future Moves Recruitment Agency
content:
Future Moves Recruitment Agency is a licensed full-fledged Human Resource firm with extensive expertise and experience in human Capital development and staffing. Future Moves has exceptional expertise in Talent Sourcing, learning & development, talent management, HR Outsourcing & Payrolling, HR planning & Consulting, Policy Drafting, Culture Change and Organisation Effectiveness by designing and implementing interventions which identify the core areas of development to enhance the overall growth and competitiveness of your organization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telesales Officer / Customer Service Representative
     

            
    



Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Work Mode: Onsite
Industry: Loans / Financial Services
Work Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Job Description


	Telesales Officers to support loan sales and customer acquisition within Nigeria’s paramilitary payroll segment. The successful candidates will be responsible for contacting verified leads, presenting loan products, converting prospects into completed applications, and following up through loan disbursement.
	This role requires strong communication skills, discipline, persistence, and the ability to meet sales targets in a structured telesales environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Contact and engage verified leads within Nigeria’s paramilitary agencies to promote loan products.
	Convert prospects into completed loan applications and follow up through successful disbursement.
	Meet and exceed assigned sales and disbursement targets through effective telesales techniques.
	Maintain accurate records of calls, applications, and follow-ups using approved tools.
	Prepare and submit regular sales and performance reports as required.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / BSc in any discipline.
	Proven experience in telesales, call center operations, or outbound sales.
	Strong communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills.
	Ability to close deals, handle objections, and meet sales targets consistently.
	Excellent follow-up, documentation, and record-keeping skills.
	Familiarity with WhatsApp and Google Forms.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision in a target-driven environment.
	Prior experience selling loans to paramilitary or government workers is an added advantage.

	N80,000 - N100,000 / Month.
	Performance-based commission
	Incentives and
	Career growth opportunities.

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

	Review and approve mechanical drawings, calculations, and technical documents.
	Manage mechanical engineering activities to ensure compliance with project scope, quality, cost, and schedule.
	Support troubleshooting, failure analysis, and reliability improvement initiatives.
	Ensure compliance with HSE, regulatory, and company standards.
	Coordinate with multidisciplinary teams, contractors, and vendors.
	Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance.
